item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "and we’ll be saying a big hello to all intelligent life forms everywhere … and to everyone else out there, the secret is to bang the rocks together, guys." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "But the plans were on display…” “On display? I eventually had to go down to the cellar to find them.” “That’s the display department.” “With a flashlight.” “Ah, well, the lights had probably gone.” “So had the stairs.” “But look, you found the notice, didn’t you?” “Yes,” said Arthur, “yes I did. It was on display in the bottom of a locked filing cabinet stuck in a disused lavatory with a sign on the door saying ‘Beware of the Leopard." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "If this is going to be a Christian nation that doesn't help the poor, either we have to pretend that Jesus was just as selfish as we are, or we've got to acknowledge that He commanded us to love the poor and serve the needy without condition and then admit that we just don't want to do it." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "A small fact: You are going to die....does this worry you?" -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by John Rogers
item.description:
"There are two novels that can change a bookish fourteen-year old’s life: <i>[book:The Lord of the Rings|10254806]</i> and <i>[book:Atlas Shrugged|9365]</i>. One is a childish fantasy that often engenders a lifelong obsession with its unbelievable heroes, leading to an emotionally stunted, socially crippled adulthood, unable to deal with the real world. The other, of course, involves orcs."
[<i>Kung Fu Monkey -- Ephemera</i>, blog post, March 19, 2009]" -- John Rogers

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Dolly Parton
item.description: "I'm not offended by all the dumb blonde jokes because I know I'm not dumb - and I'm not blonde either." -- Dolly Parton

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Bette Midler
item.description: "I have my standards. They're low, but I have them." -- Bette Midler

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Dr. Leo Martello
item.description: "The weak find an excuse, the strong find a way." -- Dr. Leo Martello

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "To be whole is to be part; true voyage is return." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Donald Trump
item.description: "Don't get sidetracked. If you do get sidetracked, get back on track as soon as possible. Ultimately sidetracking kills you." -- Donald Trump

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "I was never more hated than when I tried to be honest. Or when, even as just now I've tried to articulate exactly what I felt to be the truth. No one was satisfied" -- Ralph Ellison

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Dolly Parton
item.description: "It's a good thing I was born a girl, otherwise I'd be a drag queen." -- Dolly Parton

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by David Brent
item.description: "Life is just a series of peaks and troughs, and you don't whether you're in a trough until you're climbing out, or on a peak until you're coming down. And that's it, you know, you never know what's round the corner. But it's all good. "If you want the rainbow you've got to put up with the rain". Do you know which "philosopher" said that? Dolly Parton. And people say she's just a big pair of tits." -- David Brent

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "In the future, everybody will be world famous for fifteen minutes." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "If you can keep your head when all about you Are losing theirs and blaming it on you, If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you, But make allowance for their doubting too;!" -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "The Poet is a kinsman in the clouds Who scoffs at archers, loves a stormy day; But on the ground, among the hooting crowds, He cannot walk, his wings are in the way." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Baudelaire

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
Gaijinmama add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by J.D. Stroube
item.description: "Life is filled with unanswered questions, but it is the courage to seek those answers that continues to give meaning to life. You can spend your life wallowing in despair, wondering why you were the one who was led towards the road strewn with pain, or you can be grateful that you are strong enough to survive it." -- J.D. Stroube

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What power would hell have if those imprisoned here would not be able to dream of heaven?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description:
"CHORONZON: I am a dire wolf, prey-stalking, lethal prowler.
MORPHEUS: I am a hunter, horse-mounted, wolf-stabbing.
CHORONZON: I am a horsefly, horse-stinging, hunter-throwing.
MORPHEUS: I am a spider, fly-consuming, eight legged.
CHORONZON: I am a snake, spider-devouring, posion-toothed.
MORPHEUS: I am an ox, snake-crushing, heavy-footed.
CHORONZON: I am an anthrax, butcher bacterium, warm-life destroying.
MORPHEUS: I am a world, space-floating, life-nurturing.
CHORONZON: I am a nova, all-exploding... planet-cremating.
MORPHEUS: I am the Universe -- all things encompassing, all life embracing.
CHORONZON: I am Anti-Life, the Beast of Judgement. I am the dark at the end of everything. The end of universes, gods, worlds... of everything. Sss. And what will <b>you</b> be <b>then</b>, Dreamlord?
MORPHEUS: I am hope." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "Few tasks are more like the torture of Sisyphus than housework, with its endless repetition: the clean becomes soiled, the soiled is made clean, over and over, day after day." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "Representation of the world, like the world itself, is the work of men; they describe it from their own point of view, which they confuse with absolute truth." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Gaijinmama add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "It is not in giving life but in risking life that man is raised above the animal; that is why superiority has been accorded in humanity no to the sex that brings forth but to that which kills." -- Simone de Beauvoir
